intro: Corchorus grandiflorus, commonly known as the giant water spinach, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, spade-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in wet or marshy environments and is often found near water bodies. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus.
